crfModuleGuideline: The Activities Specific Balance Confidence Scale (ABC-Scale)
description: Developed to measure an aspect of the psychological impact of balance impairment and/or falls.

cdes.cdeName: Activities specific Balance Confidence Scale (ABC-Scale) - walk inside home scale
cdes.definitionDescription: Using the Activities-specific Balance Confidence (ABC) Scale, the level of confidence that the participant/subject reports for being able to maintain balance and remain steady when walking inside the home
cdes.questionText: How confident are you that you can maintain your balance and remain steady when you walk around the house
cdes.instructions: Use the scale of 0% = no confidence and 100% = completely confident

description: The Combat Exposure Scale (CES)

cdes.cdeName: Combat Exposure Scale (CES) - Combat patrols dangerous duty scale
cdes.definitionDescription: Scale of combat patrols or dangerous duty, as part of the Combat Exposure Scale (CES).
cdes.questionText: Did you ever go on combat patrols of have other dangerous duty?
cdes.instructions: Please circle the number above the answer that best describes your experience.
cdes.referrences: Keane, T. M., Fairbank, J. A., Caddell, J. M., Zimering, R. T., Taylor, K. L., & Mora, C. A.(1989). Clinical evaluation of a measure to assess combat exposure. Psychological Assessment, 1,53-55.
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined

cdes.cdeName: Combat Exposure Scale (CES) - Under enemy fire code
cdes.definitionDescription: Scale of number of months under enemy fire, as part of the Combat Exposure Scale (CES).
cdes.questionText: Were you ever under enemy fire?
cdes.permissibleDescription: Never;<1 month;1-3 months;4-6 months;7 months or more;
cdes.instructions: Please circle the number above the answer that best describes your experience.
cdes.referrences: Keane, T. M., Fairbank, J. A., Caddell, J. M., Zimering, R. T., Taylor, K. L., & Mora, C. A.(1989). Clinical evaluation of a measure to assess combat exposure. Psychological Assessment, 1,53-55.
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined

cdes.cdeName: Combat Exposure Scale (CES) - Killed wounded missing in action scale
cdes.definitionDescription: Scale of percentage of unit killed, wounded, or missing in action, as part of the Combat Exposure Scale (CES).
cdes.questionText: Were you ever surrounded by the enemy?
cdes.instructions: Please circle the number above the answer that best describes your experience.
cdes.referrences: Keane, T. M., Fairbank, J. A., Caddell, J. M., Zimering, R. T., Taylor, K. L., & Mora, C. A.(1989). Clinical evaluation of a measure to assess combat exposure. Psychological Assessment, 1,53-55.
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined

cdes.cdeName: Combat Exposure Scale (CES) - Fired rounds at enemy frequency scale
cdes.definitionDescription: Scale of number of times subject fired rounds at enemy, as part of the Combat Exposure Scale (CES).
cdes.questionText: What percentage of the soldiers in your unit were killed (KIA), wounded or missing in action (MIA)?
cdes.instructions: Please circle the number above the answer that best describes your experience.
cdes.referrences: Keane, T. M., Fairbank, J. A., Caddell, J. M., Zimering, R. T., Taylor, K. L., & Mora, C. A.(1989). Clinical evaluation of a measure to assess combat exposure. Psychological Assessment, 1,53-55.
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined

cdes.cdeName: Combat Exposure Scale (CES) - Surrounded by enemy scale
cdes.definitionDescription: Scale of number of times surrounded by enemy, as part of the Combat Exposure Scale (CES).
cdes.questionText: How often did you fire rounds at the enemy?
cdes.instructions: Please circle the number above the answer that best describes your experience.
cdes.referrences: Keane, T. M., Fairbank, J. A., Caddell, J. M., Zimering, R. T., Taylor, K. L., & Mora, C. A.(1989). Clinical evaluation of a measure to assess combat exposure. Psychological Assessment, 1,53-55.
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined

cdes.cdeName: Combat Exposure Scale (CES) - See someone hit by rounds scale
cdes.definitionDescription: Scale of number of times subject has seen someone hit by incoming or outgoing rounds, as part of the Combat Exposure Scale (CES).
cdes.questionText: How often did you see someone hit by incoming or outgoing rounds?
cdes.instructions: Please circle the number above the answer that best describes your experience.
cdes.referrences: Keane, T. M., Fairbank, J. A., Caddell, J. M., Zimering, R. T., Taylor, K. L., & Mora, C. A.(1989). Clinical evaluation of a measure to assess combat exposure. Psychological Assessment, 1,53-55.
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined

cdes.cdeName: Combat Exposure Scale (CES) - Danger of injury or being killed scale
cdes.definitionDescription: Scale of number of times subject was in danger of being injured or killed (pinned down, overrun, ambushed, near miss, etc.), as part of the Combat Exposure Scale (CES).
cdes.questionText: How often were you in danger of being injured or killed (i.e., being pinned down, overrun, ambushed, near miss, etc.)?
cdes.instructions: Please circle the number above the answer that best describes your experience.
cdes.referrences: Keane, T. M., Fairbank, J. A., Caddell, J. M., Zimering, R. T., Taylor, K. L., & Mora, C. A.(1989). Clinical evaluation of a measure to assess combat exposure. Psychological Assessment, 1,53-55.
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined

cdes.cdeName: Combat Exposure Scale (CES) - Combat patrols dangerous duty score
cdes.definitionDescription: Question 1 'Combat patrols dangerous duty' score, as part of the Combat Exposure Scale (CES).
cdes.instructions: Subtract 1 point from the response (i.e. a response of 5 becomes a 4). Then, multiply by 2 (i.e. your 4 now becomes an 8).
cdes.referrences: Keane, T. M., Fairbank, J. A., Caddell, J. M., Zimering, R. T., Taylor, K. L., & Mora, C. A.(1989). Clinical evaluation of a measure to assess combat exposure. Psychological Assessment, 1,53-55.
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined

cdes.cdeName: Combat Exposure Scale (CES) - Under enemy fire score
cdes.definitionDescription: Question 2 'Under enemy fire'  score, as part of the Combat Exposure Scale (CES).
cdes.instructions: Subtract 1 point from the response.
cdes.referrences: Keane, T. M., Fairbank, J. A., Caddell, J. M., Zimering, R. T., Taylor, K. L., & Mora, C. A.(1989). Clinical evaluation of a measure to assess combat exposure. Psychological Assessment, 1,53-55.
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined

cdes.cdeName: Combat Exposure Scale (CES) - Surrounded by enemy score
cdes.definitionDescription: Question 3 'Surrounded by enemy ' score , as part of the Combat Exposure Scale (CES).
cdes.instructions: Subtract 1 point from the response. (However, if the result is a 4, subtract another 1 point, changing it to a 3). Then, multiply by 2.
cdes.referrences: Keane, T. M., Fairbank, J. A., Caddell, J. M., Zimering, R. T., Taylor, K. L., & Mora, C. A.(1989). Clinical evaluation of a measure to assess combat exposure. Psychological Assessment, 1,53-55.
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined

cdes.instructions: Subtract 1 point from the response. (However, if the result is a 4, subtract another 1 point, changing it to a 3).

cdes.instructions: Subtract 1 point from the response.
cdes.referrences: Keane, T. M., Fairbank, J. A., Caddell, J. M., Zimering, R. T., Taylor, K. L., & Mora, C. A.(1989). Clinical evaluation of a measure to assess combat exposure. Psychological Assessment, 1,53-55.
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined

cdes.cdeName: Combat Exposure Scale (CES) - Total score

description: The Orientation Log (O-Log)

cdes.cdeName: Orientation Log (O-LOG)- Current city name score
cdes.definitionDescription: The score representing the participant's ability to name the current city, as part of the Orientation Log (O-LOG).
cdes.questionText: Can you tell me what city we are currently in?
cdes.instructions: Incorrect responses should be followed by cuing at the next highest level. In the place domain,  Hospital  in any context is sufficient for Kind of Place. In the domain of time, Month, Date, Year, and Day of Week must be exact; however, Clock Time can be correct to within 30 minutes (plus or minus). Patients are allowed to look at a clock without penalty when responding to the Clock Time item. For situation, the patient must be oriented to both Etiology/Event (e.g.,  What brought you into the hospital? ) and Pathology/Deficits (e.g.,  What kind of injuries did you have?  or  How did the stroke affect you? ). Situational responses must demonstrate awareness of head/brain injury and how the injury was sustained (e.g., MVA, fall, assault, GSW). Add scores down each column and plot total.
cdes.referrences: Novack, T. (2000). The Orientation Log. The Center for Outcome Measurement in Brain Injury. http://www.tbims.org/combi/olog ( accessed January 6, 2015 )
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined

cdes.definitionDescription: The score representing the participant's ability to name the current year, as part of the Orientation Log (O-LOG).
cdes.questionText: Can you tell me what is the current year?
cdes.instructions: Incorrect responses should be followed by cuing at the next highest level. In the place domain,  Hospital  in any context is sufficient for Kind of Place. In the domain of time, Month, Date, Year, and Day of Week must be exact; however, Clock Time can be correct to within 30 minutes (plus or minus). Patients are allowed to look at a clock without penalty when responding to the Clock Time item. For situation, the patient must be oriented to both Etiology/Event (e.g.,  What brought you into the hospital? ) and Pathology/Deficits (e.g.,  What kind of injuries did you have?  or  How did the stroke affect you? ). Situational responses must demonstrate awareness of head/brain injury and how the injury was sustained (e.g., MVA, fall, assault, GSW). Add scores down each column and plot total.
cdes.referrences: Novack, T. (2000). The Orientation Log. The Center for Outcome Measurement in Brain Injury. http://www.tbims.org/combi/olog ( accessed January 6, 2015 )
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined

cdes.cdeName: Orientation Log (O-LOG)- Place domain score
cdes.definitionDescription: The score representing the total place domain score which is defined as: Place = City + Kind of Place + Name of Hospital, as part of the Orientation Log (O-LOG).
cdes.instructions: Specific domain score is calculated by totalling OLOGCityNameScore, OLOGPlaceScore, OLOGHospitalNameScore and OLOGHospitalNameScore.
cdes.referrences: Novack, T. (2000). The Orientation Log. The Center for Outcome Measurement in Brain Injury. http://www.tbims.org/combi/olog ( accessed January 6, 2015 )
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined

cdes.cdeName: Orientation Log (O-LOG)- Time domain score
cdes.definitionDescription: The score representing the total time domain score which is defined as: Time = Month + Date +Year + Day of Week + Clock Time, as part of the Orientation Log (O-LOG).
cdes.instructions: Specific domain score is calculated by totalling OLOGDayWeekScore, OLOGMonthScore, OLOGTimeScore, OLOGTodaysDateScore and OLOGYearScore.
cdes.referrences: Novack, T. (2000). The Orientation Log. The Center for Outcome Measurement in Brain Injury. http://www.tbims.org/combi/olog ( accessed January 6, 2015 )
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined

cdes.cdeName: Orientation Log (O-LOG)- Situation domain score
cdes.definitionDescription: The score representing the total situation domain score which is defined as: Situation = Etiology/Event + Pathology/Deficits, as part of the Orientation Log (O-LOG).
cdes.instructions: Specific domain score is calculated by totalling OLOGPathlgyScore and OLOGEtiologyScore.
cdes.referrences: Novack, T. (2000). The Orientation Log. The Center for Outcome Measurement in Brain Injury. http://www.tbims.org/combi/olog ( accessed January 6, 2015 )
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined

description: Contains data elements related to thrombolytic/ reperfusion therapy the participant/ subject is treated with during the acute hospital stay. Many of the elements are from the Get With The Guidelines Stroke Patient Management Tool and the Paul Coverdell National Acute Stroke Registry. [Examples of CDEs included: IV tPA initiated; Reason(s) no IV tPA started at this hospital; and Type of IA procedure]

cdes.cdeName: Data collected date and time
cdes.definitionDescription: Date (and time, if applicable and known) the data were collected. This may be the date/time a particular examination or procedure was performed.
cdes.instructions: Record the date/time according to the ISO 8601, the International Standard for the representation of dates and times (http://www.iso.org/iso/home.html).  The date/time should be recorded to the level of granularity known (e.g., year, year and month, complete date plus hours and minutes, etc.).
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined

cdes.cdeName: IV tPA initiated status
cdes.definitionDescription: Indicates whether Intravenous Tissue Plasminogen Activator (IV tPA) was initiated for the participant/subject at your hospital
cdes.questionText: Was IV tPA initiated at this hospital
cdes.permissibleValue: Yes - within 0-3 hour window;Yes - within 3-4.5 hour window;No;
cdes.permissibleDescription: Yes - within 0-3 hour window;Yes - within 3-4.5 hour window;No;
cdes.instructions:
Select Yes if IV tPA was given for acute ischemic stroke. Select No If IV tPA is not initiated at your hospital, even if there are documented contraindications or warnings to IV tPA. In the case that tPA is contraindicated, select No for IV tPA initiated at your hospital and select Yes for Documented Contraindications or Warnings for not initiating IV thrombolytic in either the 0-3 hour or 3-4.5 hour treatment window.

Supplemental - Highly Recommended based on study type, disease stage and disease type
cdes.referrences: Get With The Guidelines (GWTG) Stroke Patient Management Tool Coding Instructions (Updated on 11/4/2009); Paul Coverdell National Acute Stroke Registry; The Joint Commission (TJC)
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined

cdes.questionText: Reason(s) no IV tPA started at this hospital
cdes.permissibleValue: Active internal bleeding (<22 days);CT findings (ICH, SAH, or major infarct signs);History of intracranial hemorrhage or brain aneurysm or vascular malformation or brain tumor;Platelets <100,000, PTT> 40 sec after heparin use, or PT > 15 or INR > 1.7, or known bleeding diathesis;Recent intracranial or spinal surgery, head trauma, or stroke (<3 mo.);Recent surgery/trauma (<15 days);SBP > 185 or DBP > 110 mmHg despite treatment;Seizure at onset;Suspicion of subarachnoid hemorrhage;Subacute Bacterial Endocarditis (SBE);Advanced age;Care-team unable to determine eligibility;Glucose < 50 or > 400 mg/dl;Increased risk of bleeding due to Acute pericarditis, SBE, Hemostatic defects, Diabetic hemorrhagic retinopathy, Septic thrombophlebitis/occluded AV cannula, or currently receiving oral anticoagulants;IV or IA tPA given at outside hospital;Left heart thrombus;Life expectancy < 1 year or severe co-morbid illness or CMO on admission;Pregnancy;Patient/Family refused;Rapid improvement;Stroke severity too mild;Stroke severity - Too severe (e.g., NIHSS >22);Age > 80;Prior Stroke and Diabetes;Any anticoagulant use prior to admission (even if INR < 1.7);NIHSS > 25;CT findings of >1/3 MCA;Delay in Patient Arrival;Delay in Stroke diagnosis;In-hospital Time Delay;No IV access;Other, specify;

cdes.referrences: No references available

cdes.definitionDescription: Indicator as to whether or not the limb from which the biopsy was taken was affected clinically

description: Contains data elements collected when Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (TMS) is used in headache research. [Examples of CDEs included: technique type; stimulation frequency; stimulation intensity threshold]

cdes.cdeName: Imaging study date and time
cdes.definitionDescription: Date (and time, if applicable and known) the radiologic study was obtained.
cdes.instructions: Record the date/time according to the ISO 8601, the International Standard for the representation of dates and times (http://www.iso.org/iso/home.html).  The date/time should be recorded to the level of granularity known (e.g., year, year and month, complete date plus hours and minutes, etc.).

cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to degree of involvement in one usual social roles, activities, and responsibilities, including work, family, friends, and leisure, as part of the TBI  Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Ability to Participate may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Anger T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to verbal and non-verbal components of self-reported angry mood (irritability, frustration), negative social cognitions (interpersonal sensitivity, envy,  disagreeableness), and efforts to control anger, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Anger may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Anxiety T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to symptoms that reflect autonomic arousal and experience of threat, including self-reported fear, anxious misery,  hyperarousal (tension, nervousness, restlessness), and somatic symptoms related to arousal (racing heart, dizziness), as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Anxiety may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Ask help T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to ability to and comfortability with asking others for help, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Asking for Help is only available as an 8-item fixed-length form.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Attention concentration T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to attention/concentration, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Attention/Concentration is a content-specific short form from within the TBI-QOL General Concerns item bank. Attention/Concentration is only available as a 6-item short form.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Communication comprehension T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to perceived difficulties related to oral expression, language production, articulation, comprehension, and organization, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOLCommunication/Comprehension  may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Depression T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to self-reported negative mood (sadness, guilt), views of self (self-criticism, worthlessness), and social cognition (loneliness, interpersonal alienation), as  well as decreased positive affect and engagement (loss of interest, meaning, and purpose, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOLDepression may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Emotional behavioral dyscontrol T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to a set of injury and/or treatment related manifestations including disinhibition, emotional lability, irritability, impatience, and impulsiveness, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Emotional & Behavioral Dyscontrol may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Cognition executive function T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to perceived difficulties in applications of mental function related to planning, organizing, calculating, and problem solving, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Cognition - Executive Function may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Fatigue T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to sensations ranging from tiredness to an overwhelming, debilitating and sustained sense of exhaustion that likely decreases one ability to execute daily activities and function normally in family or social roles, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Fatigue may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Cognition general concerns T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to perceived difficulties in everyday cognitive abilities such as learning, memory, attention, and concentration, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Cognition - General Concerns may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Grief loss T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to emotional reactions of grief (the natural process of reacting to a loss) such as anger, guilt, anxiety, sadness, and despair, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Grief/Loss may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Headache T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to various aspects of headache pain including subjective experience of headache pain, the quality and severity of headache pain, and consequences of headache pain on relevant aspects of one day to day life, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Headache may be as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Independence T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to perceived independence, ability to tell others about one needs, and sense of control over one life, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Independence may be as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Learning memory T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to learning and memory, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Learning/Memory is a content-specific short form from within the TBI-QOL General Concerns item bank. Learning/Memory is only available as a 6-item short form.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Mobility T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to ability to carry out various activities involving the trunk region and increasing degrees of bodily movement, ambulation, balance, or endurance, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Mobility may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Pain interference  T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to consequences of pain on relevant aspects of one life, including the extent to which pain hinders engagement with social, cognitive, emotional, physical, and recreational activities, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Pain Interference may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Resilience T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to subjective experience of the process and outcome of successfully adapting to difficult or challenging life experiences, especially highly stressful or traumatic events, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Resilience may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.

cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to satisfaction with involvement in one usual social roles, activities, and responsibilities, including work, family, friends, and leisure, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Satisfaction with Social Roles & Activities may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.

cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to assessment of one emotional, evaluative, and cognitive perceptions of competence and worth, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Self-esteem may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.

cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Stigma T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to othersperceptions of oneself and publically enacted negativity, prejudice, and discrimination as a result of injury-related manifestations, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).

cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to ability to carry out various activities involving digital, manual, and reach-related functions, ranging from fine motor to self-care (activities of daily living), as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).

cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to ability to carry out various activities involving digital, manual, and reach-related functions, ranging from fine motor to self-care (activities of daily living), as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Upper Extremity may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

subDomainName: Summary of All Outcome Measure Recommendations

crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)
description: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Ability participate social role activity T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to degree of involvement in one usual social roles, activities, and responsibilities, including work, family, friends, and leisure, as part of the TBI  Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Ability to Participate may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Anger T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to verbal and non-verbal components of self-reported angry mood (irritability, frustration), negative social cognitions (interpersonal sensitivity, envy,  disagreeableness), and efforts to control anger, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Anger may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Anxiety T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to symptoms that reflect autonomic arousal and experience of threat, including self-reported fear, anxious misery,  hyperarousal (tension, nervousness, restlessness), and somatic symptoms related to arousal (racing heart, dizziness), as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Anxiety may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Ask help T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to ability to and comfortability with asking others for help, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Asking for Help is only available as an 8-item fixed-length form.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Attention concentration T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to attention/concentration, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Attention/Concentration is a content-specific short form from within the TBI-QOL General Concerns item bank. Attention/Concentration is only available as a 6-item short form.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Communication comprehension T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to perceived difficulties related to oral expression, language production, articulation, comprehension, and organization, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOLCommunication/Comprehension  may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Depression T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to self-reported negative mood (sadness, guilt), views of self (self-criticism, worthlessness), and social cognition (loneliness, interpersonal alienation), as  well as decreased positive affect and engagement (loss of interest, meaning, and purpose, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOLDepression may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Emotional behavioral dyscontrol T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to a set of injury and/or treatment related manifestations including disinhibition, emotional lability, irritability, impatience, and impulsiveness, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Emotional & Behavioral Dyscontrol may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Cognition executive function T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to perceived difficulties in applications of mental function related to planning, organizing, calculating, and problem solving, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Cognition - Executive Function may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Fatigue T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to sensations ranging from tiredness to an overwhelming, debilitating and sustained sense of exhaustion that likely decreases one ability to execute daily activities and function normally in family or social roles, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Fatigue may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Cognition general concerns T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to perceived difficulties in everyday cognitive abilities such as learning, memory, attention, and concentration, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Cognition - General Concerns may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Grief loss T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to emotional reactions of grief (the natural process of reacting to a loss) such as anger, guilt, anxiety, sadness, and despair, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Grief/Loss may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Headache T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to various aspects of headache pain including subjective experience of headache pain, the quality and severity of headache pain, and consequences of headache pain on relevant aspects of one day to day life, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Headache may be as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Independence T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to perceived independence, ability to tell others about one needs, and sense of control over one life, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Independence may be as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Learning memory T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to learning and memory, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Learning/Memory is a content-specific short form from within the TBI-QOL General Concerns item bank. Learning/Memory is only available as a 6-item short form.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Mobility T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to ability to carry out various activities involving the trunk region and increasing degrees of bodily movement, ambulation, balance, or endurance, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Mobility may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Pain interference  T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to consequences of pain on relevant aspects of one life, including the extent to which pain hinders engagement with social, cognitive, emotional, physical, and recreational activities, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Pain Interference may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Resilience T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to subjective experience of the process and outcome of successfully adapting to difficult or challenging life experiences, especially highly stressful or traumatic events, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Resilience may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.
cdes.referrences: No references available
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.crfModuleGuideline: Traumatic Brain Injury - Quality of Life (TBI-QOL)

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Satisfaction social roles activities T-score
cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to satisfaction with involvement in one usual social roles, activities, and responsibilities, including work, family, friends, and leisure, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Satisfaction with Social Roles & Activities may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.

cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined

cdes.definitionDescription: The T-Score related to assessment of one emotional, evaluative, and cognitive perceptions of competence and worth, as part of the TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL).
cdes.instructions: TBI-QOL Self-esteem may be administered as a computerized adaptive test (CAT) or short form (SF). Either method will yield a  directly comparable T-score value on the same metric.

cdes.cdeName: TBI Quality of Life (TBI-QOL) - Stigma T-score

cdes.cdeName: Injury ICD external cause code
cdes.definitionDescription: Code to classify the external cause of the injury
cdes.questionText: and or ICD 9 CM e codes
cdes.instructions: Record as many as needed; please refer to http://www.cdc.gov/nchs/icd.htm. Response is obtained from report by subject/participant (if possible), witnesses, first responders, family and/or medical records. The cause of injury is particularly important from an epidemiologic perspective, but may also be related to mechanism of injury and consequently type and extent of brain damage.

subDomainName: History of Disease/Injury Event

description: The UCSF Screening Exam consists of 5 measures, all of which are individually described in other templates. The measures include: written verbal fluency, FBI-ALS interview, Beck Depression Inventory-II, the ALS-CBS, and the CNS-LS.
subDomainName: Summary of All Outcome Recommendations

crfModuleGuideline: UK Parkinson's Disease Society Brain Bank Criteria for the Diagnosis of Parkinson's Disease
subDomainName: Summary of All Outcome Recommendations
Academic Achievement

description: The UHDRS is a research tool which has been developed by the HSG to provide a uniform assessment of the clinical features and course of HD. The UHDRS has undergone extensive reliability and validity testing and has been used as a major outcome measure by the HSG in controlled clinical trials.
subDomainName: Summary of All Outcome Recommendations

description: Contains data elements about non-motor and motor features of Parkinson's disease. (Examples of CDEs included: Non-motor examination; Motor examination; etc.)

cdes.definitionDescription: Subject's level of intellectual impairment as part of Unified Parkinsons Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS).
cdes.permissibleDescription: None;Mild. Consistent forgetfulness with partial recollection of events and no other difficulties;Moderate memory loss, with disorientation and moderate difficulty handling complex problems, Mild but definite impairment of function at home with need of occasional prompting;Severe memory loss with disorientation for time and often to place. Severe impairment in handling problems;Severe memory loss with orientation preserved to person only. Unable to make judgments or solve problems. Requires much help with personal care. Cannot be left alone at all;

cdes.cdeName: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale (UPDRS) - Schwab England daily living scale
cdes.definitionDescription: Schwab and England Activities of Daily Living scale
cdes.questionText: Schwab and England activities of daily living
cdes.permissibleDescription: Completely independent. Able to do all chores without slowness, difficulty or impairment. Essentially normal. Unaware of any difficulty;Completely independent. Able to do all chores with some degree of slowness, difficulty and impairment. Might take twice as long. Beginning to be aware of difficulty;Completely independent in most chores. Takes twice as long. Conscious of difficulty and slowness;Not completely independent. More difficulty with some chores. Three to four times as long in some. Must spend a large part of the day with chores;Some dependency. Can do most chores, but exceedingly slowly and with much effort. Errors| some impossible;More dependent. Help with half, slower, etc. Difficulty with everything.;Very dependent. Can assist with all chores, but few alone;With effort, now and then does a few chores alone or begins alone. Much help needed;Nothing alone. Can be a slight help with some chores. Severe invalid;Totally dependent, helpless. Complete invalid;Vegetative functions such as swallowing, bladder and bowel functions are not functioning. Bedridden;
cdes.instructions: No instructions available
cdes.referrences: Fahn S, Elton RL, Members of the UPDRS Development Committee. The Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale.  In Fahn S, Marsden CD, Calne DB, Goldstein M, eds: Recent Developments in Parkinson's Disease, Vol. 2. Florham Park, NJ: Macmillan Healthcare Information, 1987. pp. 153 163, 293 304.

description: The VA Toxicity Scale Consists of two sections which focus on neurotoxicity.

cdes.cdeName: Veterans Affairs Toxicity Scale - drug-related gastrointenstinal problem indicator
cdes.definitionDescription: Indicate whether the patient has any drug-related gastrointestinal problems.
cdes.questionText: Does the patient have any drug-related gastrointestinal problems?
cdes.instructions: All toxicity is scored relative to normal for the participant/subject before starting medication
cdes.referrences: Cramer J et al. A method of quantification for the evaluation of antiepileptic drug therapy. Neurology. 1983; 33[Suppl] 11: 26-37.  Contact: joyce.cramer@yale.edu
cdes.aliasesForVariableName: Aliases for variable name not defined
cdes.previousTitle: VA Toxicity Scale  part A Q1

cdes.cdeName: Veterans Affairs Toxicity Scale - gastrointenstinal problem transient or occassionally score
cdes.definitionDescription: Circle the pre-specified scores for gastrointestional symptoms (distress, nausea, vomitting) if these symptoms occur transiently or occassionally after medication.
cdes.permissibleDescription: Transient occasional distress;Transient occasional nausea;Transient occasional vomiting;
cdes.instructions: For gastrointestinal problems (distress, nausea, vomiting), circle the highest applicable score for participant/subject symptoms and enter it in the appropriate score box. Enter zero on the other two score lines.
cdes.referrences: Cramer J et al. A method of quantification for the evaluation of antiepileptic drug therapy. Neurology. 1983; 33[Suppl] 11: 26-37.  Contact: joyce.cramer@yale.edu

cdes.instructions: For gastrointestinal problems (distress, nausea, vomiting), circle the highest applicable score for participant/subject symptoms and enter it in the appropriate score box. Enter zero on the other two score lines.

cdes.permissibleDescription: Often during the day distress;Often during the day nausea;Often during the day vomiting;
cdes.instructions: For gastrointestinal problems (distress, nausea, vomiting), circle the highest applicable score for participant/subject symptoms and enter it in the appropriate score box. Enter zero on the other two score lines.

cdes.questionText: specify drug-related gastrointestional problems other than distress, nausea or vomiting in text

cdes.questionText: Does the patient have hematopoietic system problems?
cdes.instructions: If yes, proceed to 2a.  If no, skip to part A Q3. If yes, enter a score for each the following (enter zero if not present).

cdes.cdeName: Veterans Affairs Toxicity Scale - reduced platelet count score
cdes.definitionDescription: Pre-specified scores for the reduced platelet count <75,000 (seen on more than 1 test) under two situations: drug under observation or drug discontinued. If not present, enter zero for the score
cdes.questionText: circle and enter the higher score that applies to your reduced platelet count <75,000 (seen on more than 1 test): drug under observation or drug discontinued.
cdes.instructions: Record a score. If not present, record as zero. Circle one  score only if  yes  to  reduced WBC . Enter the higher score that applies under column  Score .

cdes.instructions: Record a score. If not present, record as zero. Circle one  score only if  yes  to  reduced WBC . Enter the higher score that applies under column  Score .

cdes.cdeName: Veterans Affairs Toxicity Scale - hematopoietic problems total score
cdes.definitionDescription: Summation of the circled scores for hematopoietic system problems on the Veterans Affairs Toxicity Scale.
cdes.questionText: Sum the circled scores for hemotopoietic system problems and enter the total score
cdes.instructions: Record the total score as the summation of Q2a - Q2c

cdes.definitionDescription: Score hematopoietic problem other than reduced platelets and WBC problems, if applicable
